title: About Me
text:
I grew up in the PNW and moved to the Central Coast to attend UCSB, escape the rain, and bask my days in the sun. â˜€ï¸
Iâ€™m passionate about conservation science, marine biology, and climate outreach and education with experience working in research labs + non-profits.
Outside of academics, Iâ€™m interested in learning new recipes, traditional arts, and UI/UX design!
You can also find my resume here

Check out what Iâ€™ve been up to recently:



Iâ€™ve always loved exploring the coast. Pictured are my younger brother, Roland and I playing with sand at Canon Beach, OR â€“ We often took short weekend vacations or day trips to the coast. The water was cold, so I spent most of my time building sandcastles or peering into tidepools.





When I find the time, I like to egg my friends to take nature walks with me. My favorite hike I have taken nearby was definitely the Gaviota Wind Caves. It involved a lot of scaling near the top, but the view was worth it!



Check out what else Iâ€™m up to:

title: FUERTE
text:
The FUERTE program, is a program for undergraduates at UC Santa Barbara. Funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation, FUERTE is is a three-year research program designed to build a foundation to succeed at the university and to develop the skills needed for a career in conservation and environmental sciences, areas that specifically involve fieldwork when doing research.
âŠ¹â‚Š Ëšâ€§ï¸µâ€¿â‚Šà­¨ á°” à­§â‚Šâ€¿ï¸µâ€§ Ëš â‚ŠâŠ¹

title: FUERTE
text:
Summer 1
My first summer began with a summer field trip to the Sierra Nevada Aquatic Research Laboratory (SNARL). I learned about long-term place-based datasets, data collection and analysis. My personal project, working with Sanjana Sujeet and Andrea Estrada, examined plastic collected in the Eastern Sierras.
You can check out our presentation here:
âŠ¹â‚Š Ëšâ€§ï¸µâ€¿â‚Šà­¨ á°” à­§â‚Šâ€¿ï¸µâ€§ Ëš â‚ŠâŠ¹

title: FUERTE
text:
Summer 2
During my second summer, I participated in the DECOMP Lab. I worked with PhD Student, GermÃ¡n Silva on â€œResearching Wetland Plant Dynamics and Disturbance Response in a Changing Environmentâ€, examining how pickleweed plants can be used as environmental indicators.
I participated in on-site field research and sampling at UCSBâ€™s North Campus Open Space and campus greenhouse.
Helped develop protocol and perform data collection for pickleweed sample prep, anthocyanin extraction, chlorophyll extraction, and soil EC measurements.
âŠ¹â‚Š Ëšâ€§ï¸µâ€¿â‚Šà­¨ á°” à­§â‚Šâ€¿ï¸µâ€§ Ëš â‚ŠâŠ¹

title: FUERTE
text:
Summer 3
This summer, I will be working with CFROG, a Ventura County-based advocacy organization leading a just transition away from fossil fuels to protect our health, economy, and climate.
ğŸ™Œ Stay tuned for updates!

title: UVSA Táº¿t Festival 2025
text:
This year, I headed the 2025 Marketing Team for the nationâ€™s largest student-run Táº¿t Festival (Vietnamese Lunar New Year celebration).
â¡ï¸Developed and executed marketing campaigns overseeing a marketing budget of $26,000 to target festival audiences, researching outlets, and collecting audience data to enhance sponsorship activations.
â¡ï¸Prepared press releases and managed all promotional information including in-person events, communication with media organizations, creation of promotional flyers, social media management, and through the www.tetfestival.org website.
â¡ï¸Managed and oversaw merchandise set-up, sales, communication, and inventory day-of the festival.

My personal project, working with Sanjana Sujeet and Andrea Estrada, examined plastic collected in the Eastern Sierras.

title: FUERTE
text:
Summer 2
During my second summer, I participated in the DECOMP Lab. I worked with PhD Student, GermÃ¡n Silva on â€œResearching Wetland Plant Dynamics and Disturbance Response in a Changing Environmentâ€, examining how pickleweed plants can be used as environmental indicators.
I participated in on-site field research and sampling at UCSBâ€™s North Campus Open Space and campus greenhouse.
Helped develop protocol and perform data collection for pickleweed sample prep, anthocyanin extraction, chlorophyll extraction, and soil EC measurements.

title: Tide and Terra Magazine
text:
a UCSB mini magazine focused on communicating environmental topics- by students, from students Tide and Terra is a passion project collaboration between me and my friend, Sanjana Sujeet, that combines both our interests of science communication and environmental issues with art and creative content.
Website coming soonâ€¦
This is a draft of our first issue that will be printed in June 2024!

title: EEMB URS Presentation
text: EEMB Undergraduate Research Symposium 2024, Meet the Plastics An Evaluation on Plastics Found in Freshwater Ecosystem Lakes in the Eastern Sierras by Sanjana Sujeet, Evelyn Tsang, & Becca Reynolds
